Package Course

Class CourseCtrl

  • java.lang.Object
    • Course.CourseCtrl
  • public class CourseCtrl
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      CourseCtrl()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void checkVacancy()
      This method checks whether a particular course identified by its course ID has any vacancies by reading the appropriate information from the course file
      void createCourse()
      This method is responsible for creating a course with a unique ID after checking if the course ID entered by the user does not already exist
      void deleteCourse()
      This method deletes a course from the file if the course exists
      void editCourse()
      This method allows the user to edit the details of any course if the course exists
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> getCourseWeight​(int courseID)
      This method return course marks weights of a particular course if the course ID inputed by the user is correct
      void init()
      This function the method controller which outputs a list of options for the user to choose from with respect to the class and then calls the respective methods to be executed
      void listCourses()
      This method is responsible for displaying all the courses that have been implemented so far
      void printCourseWeight()
      This method prints the course weightages for different components and sub-components of the overall mark if the course exists
      void setCourseWeight()
      This method sets the course weightages for different components and sub-components of the overall mark if the course exists
      void viewCourse()
      This method allows the user to view the particulars of any one course according to course ID entered by the user after checking whether the course exists in the file

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
